Package com.intellij.openapi.application

Interface AppUIExecutor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BaseExpirableExecutor<AppUIExecutor>

    public interface AppUIExecutor
extends BaseExpirableExecutor<AppUIExecutor>
    An executor that invokes given runnables under Write Intent lock on Swing Event Dispatch thread or Write Thread when all constraints of a given set are satisfied at the same time. The executor is created by calling onUiThread(com.intellij.openapi.application.ModalityState) (for EDT) or onWriteThread(com.intellij.openapi.application.ModalityState) (for WT), the constraints are specified by chained calls. For example, to invoke some action when all documents are committed and indices are available, one can use AppUIExecutor.onWriteThread().withDocumentsCommitted(project).inSmartMode(project).

      • later

        AppUIExecutor later()
        Returns:
        an executor that should always invoke the given runnable later. Otherwise, if BaseExpirableExecutor.execute(java.lang.Runnable) is called on dispatch thread already, and all others constraints are met, the runnable would be executed immediately.

      • withDocumentsCommitted

        AppUIExecutor withDocumentsCommitted(Project project)
        Returns:
        an executor that invokes runnables only when all documents are committed. Automatically expires when the project is disposed.
        See Also:
        PsiDocumentManager.hasUncommitedDocuments()

      • inSmartMode

        AppUIExecutor inSmartMode(Project project)
        Returns:
        an executor that invokes runnables only when indices have been built and are available to use. Automatically expires when the project is disposed.
        See Also:
        DumbService.isDumb(Project)

      • inTransaction

        @Deprecated
AppUIExecutor inTransaction(Disposable parentDisposable)
        Deprecated. replace with later() or just remove it if you're in a write-safe context
        See Also:
        TransactionGuard
